These two queries will lead to the join of single table and sharding tables, the SQLs are following:
```
SELECT
  orderitems0_.orders_order_id AS orders_o1_2_0_,
  orderitems0_.order_items     AS order_it2_2_0_,
  orderitem1_.order_item_id    AS order_it1_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.count            AS count2_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.order_id         AS order_id3_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.product_id       AS product_4_1_1_,
  product2_.product_id         AS product_1_3_2_,
  product2_.name               AS name2_3_2_,
  product2_.price              AS price3_3_2_,
  product2_.stock              AS stock4_3_2_
FROM t_order_order_items orderitems0_ INNER JOIN t_order_item orderitem1_
    ON orderitems0_.order_items = orderitem1_.order_item_id
  LEFT OUTER JOIN t_product product2_ ON orderitem1_.product_id = product2_.product_id
WHERE orderitems0_.orders_order_id = ?;

SELECT
  orderitems0_.orders_order_id AS orders_o1_2_0_,
  orderitems0_.order_items     AS order_it2_2_0_,
  orderitem1_.order_item_id    AS order_it1_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.count            AS count2_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.order_id         AS order_id3_1_1_,
  orderitem1_.product_id       AS product_4_1_1_,
  product2_.product_id         AS product_1_3_2_,
  product2_.name               AS name2_3_2_,
  product2_.price              AS price3_3_2_,
  product2_.stock              AS stock4_3_2_
FROM t_order_order_items orderitems0_ INNER JOIN t_order_item orderitem1_
    ON orderitems0_.order_items = orderitem1_.order_item_id
  LEFT OUTER JOIN t_product product2_ ON orderitem1_.product_id = product2_.product_id
WHERE orderitems0_.orders_order_id = ?;
```

ShardingSphere will do boardcast because SQL include sharding table and the condition is not sharding column.  

There are two solutions for this problem. 
- Trying to shard **t_order_order_item** to each database;
- Trying to upgrade ShardingSphere version to 3.1.0.M1 and set **t_order_order_item** as board cast table.

BTW, I found that Hibernate will create foreign key for **t_order** --> **t_user** and **t_order_item** --> **t_product**. ShardingSphere does not support foreign keys for sharding tables currently.
I suggest you change **t_product** to boardcast table too, and bind **t_order** and **t_user**.

In 3.1.0 which will be released soon, ShardingSphere will not load all the table's TableMetaData by default.

Bug Description:
The use of Sharding-JDBC in projects equipped with iBATIS+HikariCP will lead to exception in 30 minutes after the project starts:
com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLNonTransientConnectionException: No operations allowed after connection closed.

Cause Analysis:
As initializing, Sharding-JDBC will save a copy of DatabaseMetaData citation through some connection in database connection pool. Since the default maxLifetime value of HikariCP is 1800000 (30 minutes), the connection will be taken back by the connection pool after 30 minutes. Also, iBATIS checks DatabaseMetaData before each query, if it still acquires DatabaseMetaData through that connection, the above exception will appear.

I'm so sorry for this problem. 
The API for **Spring namespace xsd for Sharding and Master-slave** has changed in 3.0.0. You can check in release lists or [ISSUE #1203](https://github.com/sharding-sphere/sharding-sphere/issues/1203). And the document has not been updated in time.

If you want to use the master-slave related function, you can download the master branch of  [sharding-sphere-example](https://github.com/sharding-sphere/sharding-sphere-example) repo and run first.

The master-slave example is in 
```
sharding-jdbc-example
    |- spring-namespace-nodep-example
       |- spring-namespace-nodep-mybatis-example
```
We will update the document as soon as possible
